intro: Tryonia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf tryonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand saline conditions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
